releases.name: ADL_LRS
releases.description: Source code for ADL's Open Source Learning Record Store (LRS), it is used to store learning data collected with the Experience API.

releases.name: DECALS
releases.description: Data for Enabling Content in Adaptive Learning Systems (DECALS) is an open-source software project to manage and repurpose courses, documents and multimedia assets

releases.name: MasterObjectModel
releases.description: The xAPI profile required to integrate with a TLA

releases.name: RUSSEL
releases.description: Re-Usability Support System for eLearning (RUSSEL) is an open-source software project to manage and repurpose courses, documents and multimedia assets

releases.name: SCORM-2004-4ed-Test-Suite
releases.description: A collection of tests designed to validate software conforming to the SCORM 2004 4th Edition

releases.name: Unity-xAPI-Wrapper
releases.description: A simple library to send and receive xAPI statements in C#, designed with Unity in mind

releases.name: cmi5-Client-Library
releases.description: Library for creating cmi5 content to work with a cmi5 conformant LMS

releases.name: flash-finder
releases.description: A set of scripts intended to help determine the severity of Flash Deprecation on a training corpus

releases.name: imi-cost-calc
releases.description: An EPSS tool for calculating IMI costs per learner for the computer-managed instruction (CMI), computer-aided instruction (CAI), and live methods of instruction, intended for use in analysis of distributed learning (DL) products using the ADDIE process. A live online version is available.

releases.name: jxapi
releases.description: A Java library to send and receive xAPI statements from a compliant LRS

releases.name: lrs-conformance-test-suite
releases.description: A collection of tests to verify an LRS is fully compliant with the xAPI specification. A live online version is available.

releases.name: tla-kafka-cluster
releases.description: A clone of the Kafka cluster used to route xAPI within ADL's TLA reference implementation. Meant as a reference tool, not a drag and drop solution to kafka

releases.name: xAPI-Android-Roses
releases.description: A sample project that depicts xAPI being leveraged on a mobile device

releases.name: xAPI-Profile-Matching
releases.description: A simple tool to match statements to existing xAPI profiles

releases.name: xAPI-SCORM-Profile
releases.description: A companion document to the Experience API Specification, designed to assist in the transition from SCORM to xAPI

releases.name: xAPI-Spec
releases.description: The full experience API (xAPI) specification

releases.name: xAPIWrapper
releases.description: A simple library to send and receive xAPI statements

releases.name: xapi-authored-profiles
releases.description: A collection of raw JSON for all of the xAPI profiles hosted on http://xapi.vocab.pub

releases.name: xapi-jqm
releases.description: A collection of templates that integrate jQuery Mobile and xAPI so that instructional designers and developers can focus on content and HTML rather than writing javascript code, without limiting their abilities to extend their statements and tracking of interactions

releases.name: xapi-profiles
releases.description: The specification for creating xAPI Profiles (A ruleset for xAPI data in a specific project)

releases.name: xapi-statement-viewer
releases.description: Simple UI that allows users to view the statements stored in an LRS. A live online version is available.

releases.name: xapi-youtube
releases.description: A toolset that allows developers to embed YouTube videos, and track interactions with these embedded videos with xAPI statements

releases.name: Shiva
releases.description: This is the source code for Shiva. Shiva is an ELF dynamic linker that is specialized for patching native Linux software. Shiva has been custom tailored towards the requirements of the DARPA AMP project and currently supports the AArch64 architecture. Open sourcing this software will expand awareness into building next-level binary patching solutions.

releases.name: Code.mil
releases.description: An experiment in open source at the Department of Defense. The goal is to foster open collaboration with the developer community around the world on DoD open source projects.

releases.name: Crossfeed Agent
releases.description: Continuous external monitoring and vulnerability scanning for organization assets

releases.name: Crossfeed Web
releases.description: Continuous external monitoring and vulnerability scanning for organization assets

releases.name: DDS.mil
releases.description: The source code for the Defense Digital Service website. This website's source code is made available to the open source community with the hope that community contributions will improve functionality, add features, and mature this work.

releases.name: ANET
releases.description: The Advisor Network (ANET) is a tool to track relationships between advisors and advisees. ANET was initially built by the Defense Digital Service in support of the USFOR-A and Resolute Support mission to train, advise, and assist the Afghan government.

releases.name: stig-manager-client-modules
releases.organization: Naval Undersea Warfare Center Division Newport, RI (NUWCDIVNPT)
releases.description: JavaScript modules for common STIG Manager client functions, such as parsing CKL/CKLB and XCCDF data.

releases.name: STIG Manager
releases.organization: Naval Undersea Warfare Center Division Newport, RI (NUWCDIVNPT)
releases.description: STIG Manager is software for managing the assessment of Information Systems for compliance with security checklists published by the United States (US) Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA)

releases.name: STIGMan-Watcher
releases.organization: Naval Undersea Warfare Center Division Newport, RI (NUWCDIVNPT)
releases.description: A STIG Manager command line client that watches a path for test result files formatted as CKL/CKLB or XCCDF and posts the results to a Collection via the STIG Manager API.

releases.name: The U.S. Army Research Laboratory (ARL) Software Release Process for Unrestricted Public Release
releases.description: This document provides procedures that ARL Government personnel MUST follow when releasing software source code and software-related material to the public, and for accepting software-related contributions from the general public.

releases.name: ParaPower
releases.description: This program is designed to facilitate the design of power electronic modules through the use of low fidelity multi-physics modeling tools.

releases.name: ARL_Topologies
releases.description: ARL_Topologies is an extensible topology optimization program meant to be both a research platform and usable in general.

releases.name: U.S. Army Research Laboratory (ARL) Discrete Chemical Compound Space Optimization (DCCSO)
releases.description: ARL DCCSO provides a framework for (constrained) optimization of molecular properties over a combinatorial set of molecules.

releases.name: Dshell
releases.description: An extensible network forensic analysis framework. Enables rapid development of plugins to support the dissection of network packet captures.

releases.name: Tracker Component Library
releases.description: This is a collection of Matlab functions that are useful in the development of target tracking algorithms.

releases.name: covid19-calculator
releases.description: Provides a set of scoring algorithms for evaluating COVID-19 symptoms implemented in TypeScript. The algorithms and associated inputs in this model are based on United States Department of Defense medical opinion and are actively used in MySymptoms.mil.

releases.name: eMCM
releases.description: Search and browse interface for the Military Courts-martial Manual.

releases.name: Move.mil
releases.description: The entry point website to the Defense Personal Property System (DPS).

releases.name: Real Time Forwarding Network - Military
releases.description: On demand private connectivity through commercial carriers

releases.name: Salvaging Static Analysis (SalSA)
releases.description: The hope is that this project allows for the analyst to automate the static analysis process and quickly triage malware based on a robust set of homebuilt rules based on current white-papers in industry.

releases.name: gamechanger-data
releases.description: GAMECHANGER data pipelines, jobs, and machine learning API

releases.name: gamechanger
releases.description: GAMECHANGER meta-repository. GAMECHANGER aspires to be the Department’s trusted solution for evidence-based, data-driven decision-making across the universe of DoD requirements

releases.name: Conduit
releases.description: Conduit is a curation tool that allows anyone to collect articles of interest from multiple feeds, make formatting changes, comments on articles on the fly then group selected items into "books" to target particular readers.

releases.name: mymove
releases.description: Personal Property Prototype
